fields_of_interest: Trade, Customs, Environment, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Research and innovation, External Relations, Trans-European Networks, Food Safety, Transport, Climate Action
eu_initiatives: PLASTICS has communicated with the European Chemicals Agency (ECHA) and others regarding the Registration, Evaluation, Authorisation and Restriction of Chemicals (REACH) Regulation.; e.g., with respect to polymers. Additional EU discussions involve phthalates, reporting requirements, use of polyvinyl chloride (PVC), titanium dioxide (TiO2) and sustainability issues.
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
goals__remit: The Plastics Industry Association (PLASTICS), formerly SPI, is the only organization that supports the entire plastics supply chain, representing nearly one million workers in the $418 billion U.S. industry. Since 1937, PLASTICS has been working to make its members and the industry more globally competitive while advancing recycling and sustainability.
